CatDescriptText: Mr. Edward Fullgraf, Washington, Pa, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, p. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "I think that it's all right. She's made up her mind what she wants to do, after being undecided for a long time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edward Fullgraf, wearing dark fedora and zippered jacket, standing with hands behind back in front of marble wall between store windows with jewelry, and lamp display with sign that reads "Reduced Crystal Vanity Lamps and Shades"
